channel.title: Text Mining TEL Blogs 2012-11-25
channel.description: Scanning TEL Blogs for significantly economic, political or legal posts in the 14 days prior to 25 Nov, 2012 .

item.title: Gates Backs MIT Online Course Offering at Community Colleges
item.dc:creator: Online Learning Update
item.description: By John Lauerman, Business Week Two Boston-area community colleges will offer an adapted version of a Massachusetts Institute of Technology online course in computer science with funding from the Bill & Melinda Gates Foundation. Bunker Hill and MassBay community colleges will list the course — Introduction to Computer Science and Programming — beginning early next year, officials from the colleges said today. The course will combine materials from MIT and Harvard University&#82...

item.title: Asia’s online learning market ‘the strongest in the world’
item.dc:creator: Online Learning Update
item.description: by Virtual College (UK) Asia has the highest growth rate worldwide for online learning and revenues are predicted to top $11. 5 billion (£7. 2 billion) by 2016. This is according to a new report from market research specialist Ambient Insight, which analysed the circumstances of sixteen nations in its survey The Asia Market for Self-paced eLearning Products and Services. It found the growth rate for digital education on the continent – focussing on countries such as India, China, Jap...

item.title: Online learning to shape future of education in India
item.dc:creator: Online Learning Update
item.description: by Suneera Tandon, Live Mint and the Wall Street Journal Technology may be the magic cure India needs for the ills that plague its school education, executives from companies providing technology solutions for classrooms said in a discussion at the World Economic Forum’s India Economic Summit, 2012. Education has a role to play in efforts of a country looking to transforming itself from a middle-income economy to a high-income one said the discussion’s moderator, Gordon Brown, U...

item.title: Virtual Set Editor 2 Ships
item.dc:creator: Techlearning
item.description: NewTek announces the shipment of Virtual Set Editor 2, a companion application to TriCaster™ that allows for creation and customization of virtual studio environments and visual effects for video production, without the need for professional studio space. Virtual Set Editor 2 Provides: Standalone capability Total customization Photorealistic look Animation Store Creator Easier collaborative workflows Starter-pack virtual sets Pricing Virtual Set Editor 2 (include...

item.title: Election Impact on US Educational Technology Policy
item.dc:creator: Yes Tech!
item.description: This post is copied word-for-word, with permission, from Hilary Goldmann’s Voices Carry blog. Hilary is the Director for Government Affairs, ISTE. She wrote this blog post on Nov 7, 2012, the day after Election Day. After all of the dollars spent, countless advertisements and robocalls, we woke up today to elected Executive and Legislative branches of government that in composition appear very similar to the one we had prior to the election. President Obama was re-elected to a sec...

item.title: MOOC Brigade: Can Online Learning Courses Keep Students from Cheating?
item.dc:creator: Online Learning Update
item.description: By Kayla Webley, Time Last week, the American Council on Education (ACE), a Washington-based higher education organization that represents college presidents, announced that it would be using a grant from the Bill & Melinda Gates Foundation to begin evaluating a handful of courses from Coursera, a MOOC provider that launched in April, to see if they are worthy of college credit. ACE, which has some 1,800 member schools, will apply the same evaluation method it has used for years to assess o...

item.title: Special issue CFPs on MOOCs, Open Education, and e-research
item.dc:creator: George Veletsianos
item.description: I don’t think I’ve come across as many interesting special issue call for proposals at the same time. In case you are interested, here are some that are worthwhile and current: Journal of Online Learning and Teaching (JOLT) special issue on Massive Open Online Courses (MOOCs): http://t. co/wj0J6RpD (pdf). Edited by George Siemens, Valerie Irvine, and Jillianne Code. Closed on the 15th, but deadline extended until the 19th. Learning, Media, and Technology Journal special is...
